name: Icelandair "80 Years of Aviation" 757-256 [TF-FIR] Landing and Takeoff at Edmonton Airport ᴴᴰ
description:
Just three weeks ago, Icelandair unveiled a new special livery celebrating their 80th anniversary on TF-FIR, one of their many 757s. The Vatnajökull glacier, the largest glacier in Europe, is featured prominently along the aircraft, which was revealed in Norwich, England on May 3rd. "Vatnajökull" has been to Edmonton once before, but last weekend I was fortunate enough to be there the day it flew in, and what a fantastic livery it is. Icelandair nailed it! Still have to see Hekla Aurora though, but I'm very glad to have filmed this amazing aircraft just a three hour drive from YYC. This video includes the arrival and departure of "Vatnajökull" on May 20th, 2017, with ATC included. Enjoy!

Thanks for watching!

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

FLIGHT INFO
Airline: Icelandair (ICE/FI)
Aircraft: Boeing 757-200 (B752)
Aircraft Name: "Vatnajökull"
Livery: "80 Years of Aviation"
Engines: 2x RR RB211-535E4 
Registration: TF-FIR
Route: KEF-YEG-KEF
Callsign: Ice Air 693/692 heavy
Runway used: 30
Date filmed: May 20, 2017
Local time: 1730, 1830
FlightAware: http://flightaware.com/live/flight/TFFIR
